@graph.description: Vegan Enchiladas Recipe. Easy Enchilada Recipe with Blender Enchilada Sauce, soft tortillas filled with black beans, spinach and lentils. Vegan Soy-free Recipe. Can be Gluten-free. Ready within 1 Hour. Makes 1 rectangular pan (8 by 12). (Pictured in 9 by 9 pan. You might have some leftover filling and sauce depending on how many tortillas you fit in). .

recipeIngredient: 1/4 tsp or more cayenne ( or chipotle pepper)
Add taco seasoning or other seasoning of choice (optional)
1/2  of the cooked onion garlic mixture from above
1/2  or more ancho chili or chili powder blend or chipotle pepper powder (add according to hear preference)
1/2 tsp or more salt to taste
1/2 tsp or more sugar or other sweetener
Soft tortillas or Corn Tortillas 6 to 8
cilantro (red onion, lime juice for garnish)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F / 190Âºc. Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add onions, garlic and a pinch of salt. Cook until translucent. 5 to 6 mins. Reserve a half of the mixture for the enchilada sauce.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F / 190Âºc. Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add onions, garlic and a pinch of salt. Cook until translucent. 5 to 6 mins. Reserve a half of the mixture for the enchilada sauce.

recipeInstructions.text: Make the filling: Add the rest of the ingredients (beans, lentils, spinach, spices, water). Mix in, cover and cook for 8 to 10 minutes over medium-high heat. Taste and adjust heat, flavor and salt.
recipeInstructions.name: Make the filling: Add the rest of the ingredients (beans, lentils, spinach, spices, water). Mix in, cover and cook for 8 to 10 minutes over medium-high heat. Taste and adjust heat, flavor and salt.

recipeInstructions.text: Make the Blender Enchilada sauce: Meanwhile blend the ingredients under the enchilada sauce + the reserved cooked onions and garlic. Taste and adjust heat, salt and flavor.
recipeInstructions.name: Make the Blender Enchilada sauce: Meanwhile blend the ingredients under the enchilada sauce + the reserved cooked onions and garlic. Taste and adjust heat, salt and flavor.

itemListElement.text: Add half of the sauce on the baking tray. Fill the tortillas with lentil bean filling, fold and place seam side down.
itemListElement.name: Add half of the sauce on the baking tray. Fill the tortillas with lentil bean filling, fold and place seam side down.

itemListElement.text: Drizzle remaining sauce all over the tortillas. Bake for 20 mins.
itemListElement.name: Drizzle remaining sauce all over the tortillas. Bake for 20 mins.

itemListElement.text: Garnish generously with red onion, cilantro, avocado, black pepper and lime/lemon juice. Serve hot.
itemListElement.name: Garnish generously with red onion, cilantro, avocado, black pepper and lime/lemon juice. Serve hot.
